job_title: Animal Care Attendant in Richmond, BC
pros: Love working with animals, learn a lot about basic animal care
cons: Can't think of any cons at the moment

pros: The team I am in, at least, is incredibly supportive and helpful. My boss and colleagues always reach out to check in and offer guidance. Fulfilling - it's good to know the work you're doing is helping animals! Good vacation time - 4 weeks available after 3 months in Manager role. Tons of resources, lots of ways to learn.
cons: Takes more 'after hours' work than I anticipated, sometimes late night phone calls with vets or for emergencies - this might be me underestimating rather than an issue with the role. Hard to navigate union employees with delayed bargaining Feels like low compensation for the amount of work being done. Training is a bit sporadic - they put aside time in the beginning to train but then it's hard to find time once you're onboarded since there is so much to do. I feel like I don't know key things because can't find the time to train further. Encourage work life balance but this is hard to actually strike with the work. After hours events sometimes, always on call.

review_title: They have a good mission but not the stable foundation to support it.
pros:
Working with like minded people with the same mission of helping animals in need.
Good branding and they try to work towards being a successful organization.
cons:
Dangerous lack of competance, resources and staffing for an NPO as wealthy as this one which can put animals lives at risk. Toxic and cliquey work culture created by senior leadership. Awful communication from PO, lack of organization and are completely out to lunch on what's happening in the workplaces and their people. Frequent complaints about senior management go nowhere. Org will take the lowest bidder instead of the better candidate for a major leadership role and will allow them to freely cause destruction, confusion and upset with no supervision, questions to their team or any kind of accountability. 
Big egos trying to run the show, most are majorly overworked. The mass exodus of their employees continues with red flags ignored and no questions asked.

review_title: Fulfilling, just not to my wallet
pros: Working with animals, small team, passionate coworkers, better pay than other clinics
cons: compassion fatigue, poor pay, poor mental health support, not much upward mobility

pros: You will be working with many dedicated people.
cons: upper management pushing growth at a rapid pace and not providing enough support from low levels.

review_title: If you love animals, prepare to have your heartbroken
pros:
I loved my work
RRSP plan was great
Most people are there for the animals
cons:
Animals euthanized for no reason
You aren't allowed to stand up for the animals when you see what is happening is not in the best interest of the animals
Bullying by Branch Manager
HR doesn't do anything when people complain about bullying

pros: The cutest animals that you get to spend time with and fairly easy work.
cons: Almost always a horrible smell from some of the rats and cats and not the most sanitary environment.

review_title: Great place to start a career and get experience
pros:
-Easy to move up to different positions
-Lots of different jobs you can move to
cons: -Wages lower than private sector

pros:
Working for the good of animals
Dedicated staff
Access to veterinary advice
Bring your dog at the office
Great coworkers & supervisor
cons:
Lots of administrative work
Old office space, not much natural light for most of the offices, lots of shared offices
Gossip

pros: flexible hours, flexible vacations, learning facilities, eduaction of the public
cons: poor communication inter and intra departments

job_title: Animal Care Attendant in Burnaby, BC
pros: Excellent experience and exciting job.
cons: terrible pay for a very hard job.

job_title: Animal Care Attendant in Cowichan Bay, BC
pros: Very mental health oriented and amazing g
cons: It’s a hard job to see cruelly cases

pros: best company to work for
cons: best employer to work for

job_title: Call Centre Representative in Victoria, BC
pros: Very interesting job content, good pay for the role, supportive management
cons: Responding to members of the public calling in about a crisis without crisis experience/training

pros: I think everyone starts here because of their love of animals and wanting to make a difference in our little piece of the world. The ideology is inspiring and a worthy cause! Saving animals and finding them forever homes is amazing!
cons: Unless you are an ACO or APO your starting salary is just above minimum wage! Unless you are permanent or in a time durated position for 1yr you will not get a wage increase. In order to gain seniority as an auxiliary (which you will need to work 910 hours in order to have seniority). While the job does have many heart warming feel good moments many more are gut wrenching and at times dangerous.  Many employees have PTSD from the things they have witnessed and experienced, and no support to recover from it!  The place is riddled with politics and bad communication about policy and procedure, rules vary from shelter to shelter...if you want transparency this is not the place for you! Its unfortunate that the environment is very toxic.  I love my job just not the way the shelters are run!

pros: Making a difference, and great karma
cons: High Burn out, poor management and high demand on employees to work constantly

pros: Very welcoming and fun environment!
cons: I have no cons to write at all!

review_title: Not for the Faint of Heart
pros: Some of the most profound moments of joy have happened here. Daily contact with animals is very therapeutic! Ability to facilitate miracles. You really feel like you are making a difference.
cons: Very low pay, culture of overwork and self sacrifice. "Lives outside of work" are regarded as interfering with the mission. High density of zealots.

review_title: A great organization, but in need of more focus on the quality of life of the people who work there.
pros: Good benefits, important mission, a leader in the field.
cons: Lack of performance management and opportunities for growth of promising staff.

review_title: Great people, from volunteer up to CEO. Very caring. All animal owners and lovers.  Very supportive environment.
pros: Really try to take care of the staff at all levels. Very human caring company.
cons: Can be physically and emotionally taxing to care for so many animals.

pros:
- Great values and mission
- Pet friendly workplace
- Great co workers
cons:
- Not enough communication between HO and branches
- Not enough work/life balance
- A lot of people are over worked

pros: Pet Hospital has dedicated staff members providing high quality patient care
cons: Long wait times  and high employee turnover

pros: Passionate, satisfying work, community minded
cons: Lack of communication, disjunction between provincial office and branches, some extremist policies/procedures, very Lower Mainland focussed

review_title: Very pleasant and enjoyable to work with.
pros: Working here gave me a feeling like I was really doing something good.
cons: You can get messy. Think cat hair, dog hair etc.
